name: Latham Hotel

reviews.text: Renovated boutique hotel in best part of town. Moderately priced. Very good value. Short walk to dozens of bars and restaurants. Breakfast was FANTASTIC. Recommend the Urban Breakfast. Rooms were smallish, but very comfortable. Bathrooms are basic but immaculate. Staff were super helpful and very polite. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Weekend After the Hurricane

reviews.text: Do NOT waste your time or money staying at this hotel. First of all, the staff is so nasty and snobby it is embarrassing. They are rude and gave the most expensive recommendations where I have since learned "they get free services" there. Really not helpful. If you need anything it is an inconvenience to them and they do NOT know or care to know the area. As for the rooms , they were clean I will give them that but very small with very uncomfortable beds. Also, the heat blew cold air in November?? This was not specific to us ,apparently it happened to a few others as well and of course we had to ask three times for a blanket. We have traveled a great deal and stayed everywhere from great boutique hotels to the ritz carlton but this place was awful one very level. We could not wait to leave...
reviews.title: One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last week 19th October 2012 and it is truly a boutique hotel! Beautiful bedding, decor and the bathroom is to die for.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

reviews.text: The staff were wonderful especially Stacey, and the young doorman was extremely helpful in finding us somewhere to eat in the evening. I would recommend the Dandelion pub for a great meal and quirky surround!ings
reviews.title: My new favorite hotel in Philadelphia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all our stay in Philly was made all the better for staying in this great hotel.
reviews.title: Very Helpful and Considerate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an overall very good stay at this hotel. It was marathon weekend so most hotels were booked or had very inflated rates. I was fortunate to get a good deal at this hotel, on a booking sight. The only type of room available was 2 double beds. I preferred a king but was just happy to get the reservation at a good price.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great locations, it really can't be beat. Walkable to most major sights. We arrived Saturday late morning. When we check in I asked if it was possible to get a king room. At first they said no (which didn't surprise me since we got such a reasonable rate). It was our 25th wedding anniversary, so I told them and said I'd really like to have a king room if possible, and we'd be more than happy to check in later in the day, should one become available. The young ladies at the front desk, Stacia (sp?) and Stacey, checked around, and were able to come up with a king room that was available for early check-in! They then offered the free car service (provided by the hotel on first come first serve basis). We took the services to the Barnes collection (which is amazing).
reviews.title: Loved the Latham

reviews.text: The only problems, and minor at that, was that the room did not have any glasses! Only 2 paper coffee cups. Later in the evening we called and asked for some, but they weren't delivered after an hour or so and we left for dinner. When we returned, still no glasses. We called again, and this time they showed up fairly quickly. Also the bathroom door did not close completely for some reason but again, this did not create a major problem.
reviews.title: Home from Home

reviews.text: Overall we were very happy with the Latham Hotel. The room was nicely furnished, clean and comfortable. The front desk help was delightful, the free car service, a nice perk, and the location can't be beat.
reviews.title: Delighted with the Latham

reviews.text: They have very limited street parking so it's great that they have a Valet service. Every employee we encountered was professional and courteous. The housekeeper was so sweet and helpful. The hotel is an older building that's been redone. The rooms are smallish (not tiny but not big either) but our room was immaculate and gorgeously decorated. They had a nice sized closet so we could get our suitcases out of the way and hang our clothes up. We only had breakfast at the restaurant and it was excellent but a little pricey ($35 for two) In all, a great experience -we would go back.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel completes Philly experience!

reviews.text: My elderly parents and I were very pleased with our 5-night stay at the Latham. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the location was perfect for shopping and dining, and the food at the restaurant was very good. But what really distinguished our stay was the kindness of the staff. Everyone went out of their way to be helpful. They also provided a free car service to and from locations within Center City, which eliminated the need for long walks or taxis. The hotel is not as grand as some of its luxury hotel neighbors, but in exchange it offers the type of personal attention that you could expect from a good B&B.
reviews.title: Great service, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to the Latham for our anniversary. We filled out the emailed questionaire asking if this trip was a special occasion so we mentioned that it was our anniversary. We celebrate at a different hotel in a different city each year. We were wished Happy Anniversary when we checked in but that was it. Every hotel we have stayed at for thisd occasion has always left something special in our room. Nothing here at all. The staff was very nice and the room was lovely although the water pressure was so bad I had to wash my hair under the faucet. We had breakfast there as well and although delicious they messed up my husbands order and the server told us she usually never waits tables. What happened to the waitstaff? The bellman in the morning was standing there while we opened the hotel door ourselves. The doorman in the evening was much betterThe location was great but there are many improvements to be made. I am a manager in the hospitality industry and we always do something for special occasions. We will stay elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: Needs improvement.

reviews.text: Although the hotel is an attractive, historical building when viewed from its exterior, neither the rooms nor the lobby have preserved much of the past. The rooms are for the most part tasteful but bland, and the primary reason to stay here would be its central location and cleanliness. There is no view to speak of whether your room faces Walnut, 17th St or the back of the property. The staff are not that personable.
reviews.title: Bland but clean rooms in a central location

reviews.text: On the basis of other reports of its newly completed renovation, I stayed at The Latham and was very pleased.
reviews.title: Very nice, central choice; newly renovated small hotel.

reviews.text: Located is a small, handsome 14-story building from the early 20th Century, its top to bottom renovation was well done. The staff were uniformly pleasant, professional, and eager to be helpful. The room (#1204) was comfortable and thoughtfully appointed, clean and fresh; it was also a good bit larger than suggested in the otherwise accurate hotel website photos. Everything in the room and nicely finished marble bath was spotless and well maintained, with the usual corporate clutter of hotel messages and promotions kept to a bare minimum. Beds were very comfortable. If there was a fault to the room it was in a somewhat loud air conditioning duct (which worked well otherwise.) The bathroom was stocked with an embarrassment of thick towels and a good selection of Gilchrist & Soames toiletries; it was not huge but certainly not too tight, and handsomely designed. Free wifi was very easy and worked well; the furnishings were well chosen. Curtains worked easily and completely -- they could be fully closed and fully opened with no effort, and it's a nice city view.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: I've been doing business in Center City for years & consequently, have been in quite a few very nice hotels in this area. I keep returning to the Latham. I do so because the location can't be beat, & like other CC establishments can drop off my car right in front of the hotel with minimal hassle. Their rooms are somewhat smallish & are soothing, nicely appointed & clean. (Btw, speak directly with the front desk to see if you can get a room with a view - many reveal terrific vistas of the city.) The Latham, after it's needed recent renovation, offers a lovely bar & restaurant - one where you'd be pleased to meet clients, friends, family. The wait staff was pleasant & the food was prepared with care & imagination. There's a new off-the-lobby lounge: a perfect, low key place to land in between my meetings. But for me, and here's The Swing Vote, the Doorman, Joe, is superb. Been @ the Latham over 30, or is it 40? years. Easy to get along with, highly knowledgeable about all things Philadelphia & you aren't just Another Face in the Crowd. What a concept. I've seen him extend this remarkable effort to the other Latham guests - and to their & my guests, as well (!), year upon year. Joe keeps an eye out for your personal security & possessions, how you are, what you need, & as mentioned is a font of information on everything ala Philly - all without being obsequious or fawning. What a pleasure. Throw in the newly available, & I do mean available --- not-the -always-out-on-another-call-&-not-available limo service (driver retired police officer, a delight) & I will continue to book @ the Latham.
reviews.title: Look no further in Center City Philly ~

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Latham Hotel was an important contribution to a really great stay in downtown Philadelphia. The staff were friendly, attentive and helpful, and everything happened quickly and with ease. I had sent an email simply saying we were making our first visit to Philly and wanted to have a view, we found ourselves on the 13th floor with a corner room with views all over downtown! We didn't try the restaurant or room service (already had so many great options around town), but they looked fine. Overall a great hotel, highly recommended and would probably return. Only negative - the "high-speed" wireless internet was slow and unreliable.
reviews.title: A Great Place for a visit to Philadelphia

reviews.text: Superb boutique hotel in the middle of it all (neither too big nor too small -- just right for those who want to feel that they belong and are well taken care of while having just the right amount of privacy). The location, staff, rooms (nicely decorated but needed more hangers and more space to hang/dry towels as I don't like to get them washed everyday -- ideally), great Gilcrest and Soames toiletries, service, price. My experience couldn't have been better, and i'm picky (but always reasonable -- you get what you pay for in life: for instance a $150 room shouldn't be reviewed as a $300 room).
reviews.title: Superb hotel in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However sometimes in life a $150 room can be better than a $300 room and in the case of the Latham, I could have paid double elsewhere and done worse.
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Congratulations and thank you to all involved -- I will definitely be back. You helped me fall in love with Philadelphia...
reviews.title: Right in the middle of it all!

description: A quaint hotel located near shopping district.
